intro: Elaphoglossum exsertipes, commonly known as the erect fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Dryopteridaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, lanceolate fronds that are typically upright and rigid. The plant has a short, creeping rhizome and produces sporangia on the underside of its leaves. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Elaphoglossum exsertipes prefers moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
